Renderable.cpp

Contains implementation for CRenderable

Functions
CRenderable
CRenderable::CRenderable(
IRenderSubMesh *pSubMesh,
IRenderMaterial *pFrontMaterial,
IRenderMaterial *pBackMaterial,
DirectX::XMMATRIX &mat
) : m_xform(mat)

Creates a renderable object. A Renderable is a IRenderSubMesh paired with a set of materials and a shader.

Parameters
pSubMesh
IRenderSubMesh*

Render submesh pFrontMaterial Material to apply to front facing polygons pBackMaterial Material to apply to back facing polygons

mat
DirectX::XMMATRIX&

world matrix to apply

RenderMesh
void CRenderable::RenderMesh(
IGraphics *pGraphics,
std::vector<CRefObj<IPointLight>> &lights,
IRenderCtx *pRenderCtx,
IRenderMaterial *pRenderMaterial,
D3D11_CULL_MODE cullmode
)

Renders either the front or back faces of a mesh

Parameters
pGraphics
IGraphics*

graphics device

lights
std::vector<CRefObj<IPointLight>>&

List of lights to apply

pRenderCtx
IRenderCtx*

Rendering context

pRenderMaterial
IRenderMaterial*

Material to apply

cullmode
D3D11_CULL_MODE

Culling mode to apply

DirectX::XMMATRIX &mat
)

Creates a renderable object

Parameters
pSubMesh
IRenderSubMesh*

Submesh to create renderable for

pFrontMaterial
IRenderMaterial*

material for front faces

pBackMaterial
IRenderMaterial*

material for back faces

mat
DirectX::XMMATRIX&

transform to apply

Returns

Returns the created renderable
